thread.title: Super Bowl Ads Split Between Humor and Unity
thread.title_full: Super Bowl Ads Split Between Humor and Unity - WSJ

author: Suzanne Vranica
title: Super Bowl Ads Split Between Humor and Unity
text:
A sexy Mr. Clean, a sloppy Terry Bradshaw, and a pot-seeking Snoop Dogg all featured in the Super Bowl commercials that scored big with marketing experts, in a year when weighty ads on political and social themes were also on full display.

Procter & Gamble Co. aired a spot featuring an animated version of the decades-old icon for its multipurpose household cleaner, Mr. Clean, dancing, thrusting and mopping as a woman looks on...
